title: Setting ReferenceOutputAssembly to falso on references to esproj
body: Esprojs may be referenced by ASP.Net projects (or others). When this happens, the .net project will have to not reference output assembly on the esproj, because there is no output assembly. This targets provides that behavior. There was an argument for putting this in this file instead of in the sdk. The discussion can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/34983

commit.message:
Setting ReferenceOutputAssembly to falso on references to esproj
Esprojs may be referenced by ASP.Net projects (or others). When this happens,
the .net project will have to not reference output assembly on the esproj,
because there is no output assembly. This targets provides that behavior.
There was an argument for putting this in this file instead of in the sdk.
The discussion can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/34983
Only change the default, don't mess with explicit settings either way

nodes.body: Huzzah! Tests are green and there are two approving reviews. @rainersigwald if we merge this today it should still be part of RC2, right?
